actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 5, 2024.

Pursuant to section 3 of H. Res. 922, the Chair announced that no organizational or legislative business will be conducted on this day. Messages requiring action will be laid before the House on a subsequent day. Bills and resolutions introduced today will receive a number but will not be referred to a committee or noted in the Record until a subsequent day. Executive communications, memorials, and petitions likewise will be referred and numbered on a subsequent day.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened pursuant to the 20th Amendment to the Constitution and was called to order by the Chair.
Pursuant to the 20th Amendment to the Constitution, the Chair declares the 1st Session of the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress adjourned sine die.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
